intro: Connarus monocarpos subsp. malayensis, commonly known as the Malay connarus, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by capsule fruits that release minute seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
